PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8621 - VMware Cloud Foundation: Technical Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Join members of the VMware Cloud Foundation architecture and engineering teams for a presentation on the technical details of Cloud Foundation deployment. This session covers a wide range of topics including hardware, networking, Cloud Foundation software, monitoring, and life-cycle management.

Presenters.Name: Mark LaRoche, VMware Integrated Systems Business Unit
Presenters.LastName: Mark LaRoche, VMware Integrated Systems Business Unit

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8472 - An IT Architect's Guide to the Software-Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In the face of an ever-changing IT landscape, the reality is that businesses can no longer afford for IT organizations to design and architect their compute, storage, and network solutions independent of each other. To remain relevant, IT organizations need to embrace new technologies and adopt a holistic design approach. The good news is that it may not be as difficult as you think. VMware experts have been working hard to develop a comprehensive set of design guidelines and recommendations to help you architect a modern data center based on the VMware Software-Defined Data Center architecture. We cover both physical and logical design considerations across compute, storage and network, and equip you with the skills and knowledge you need to design, architect and implement a modern private cloud that will power your business, today, tomorrow, and well into the future.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7780 - Agile: The Scrum Master for Your Software-Defined Data Center!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: You virtualized the SERVERS to reduce Capex and Opex in your data centers. You virtualized the STORAGE to make it inexpensive but remain high performance. You virtualized the NETWORK to make it simple yet secured. Guess what? You have embraced the power of a software-defined data center! While VMware allows you to build your infrastructure in the software tier, it is important that you quickly learn how to manage the lifecycle of this software-defined infrastructure and the services it has to offer. When the world of software development is moving towards agile frameworks, it only makes sense to leverage the same to help deploy, run, and scale your software-defined data center. Alongside lifecycle management of the various components of SDDC, Agile frameworks can also help IT build and deliver various services tailored to the requirements of business needs. This methodology of managing IT infrastructure as a piece of software code is no longer a distant dream. Concepts such as DevOps are clearly trying to deliver the missing development piece in the current operational structures of organizations. Frameworks like Agile with methodologies such as Scrum, DSDM, XP etc. make it possible for you to maximize your investments in SDDC.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8468R - A Beginner's Guide to the Software-Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Welcome to the Software-Defined Data Center. Learn how to achieve secure, rapid delivery of infrastructure and applications in your on-premises data center with the same ease of use, scale, and cost that is available in the public cloud. We start with an overview of the core SDDC building blocks, to include compute virtualization (vSphere), software-defined storage (VSAN/VVOLs), and software-defined networking (vSphere Distributed Switch + NSX). We then look at how combining monitoring together with management and automation (vRealize Suite) enables IT organizations to realize the benefits of self-service along with the secure, rapid delivery of infrastructure, applications, and services across the private cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7886 - Implementing An Operating Model for Agility: A Customer Success Story
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Operations transformation is front and center for many large enterprise organizations that are looking to evolve to a more agile and service-oriented approach. VMware's operations transformation teams are partnering with many of these organizations to help them understand the impact and steps required to transform and scale to meet the growing global demands of enterprise businesses. This session will discuss one of VMware's largest customers (a global financial services provider), their transformation journey, and how VMware has helped guide them to make their strategic vision a reality.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9971 - Experience the Business Impact of IT Innovation & Transformation in this Live Interactive Simulation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Join your peers in IT leadership for a live interactive simulation where you get to experiment on what series of IT initiatives will lead to the greatest impact on business revenue and IT costs. This is a unique experiential learning session. Using a software-based simulation platform, our facilitators will present you with a variety of IT innovation project options, representing a wide spectrum from developing cloud capabilities to advanced micro-segmentation. Acting as a company with a set budget for operating expenses and innovation, your team will choose which projects to focus and then see the results of your selections. Will revenue increase because you were able to speed time to market? Will your operating expenses increase or decrease? Will you experience set-backs if you focus on one area but neglect others? Test your IT strategy theories, participate in lively discussions about today options in IT, and walk away with tips for how to build a roadmap for innovation that will work for your organization. Appropriate for participants who are at a Director level and up.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8414 - VMware Validated Design for SDDC: A Technical Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Let's face it: It's not easy to design and implement a Software-Defined Data Center. Think about all the elements from compute, storage, network and security, to automation and operations. There are a thousand ways to put those elements together to make something that works. But not all of them produce the best result for your business. What you need is a blueprint. Blueprints spell out exactly which elements you need, and the precise way to put them together to create the strongest, most highly available and resilient Software-Defined Data Center solution. That's why we've established the VMware Validated Design, or VVD. We've done the hard work of synthesizing the elements into a standardized, streamlined, system-level design that reduces deployment risk, decreases time-to-value and makes it easy to manage the day-to-day operations. In this session we will discuss and demonstrate fundamental constructs and design decisions of the VMware Validated Designs. From the physical to virtual infrastructure you'll gain a clear understanding of basis for all the designs and how it's used to rapidly and repeatedly deliver a ready-to-run Software-Defined Data Center.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7502 - On the Front Line: A VCDX Perspective Working in VMware Global Support Services
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How many people get the opportunity to "walk a mile in their colleagues shoes"? This panel of four well-known VCDXs had the opportunity to spend a month working in VMware Global Support Services (GSS), where they were involved in closing nearly 400 support requests. During this period, valuable insight and feedback were shared with customers and GSS, and valuable lessons were learned all around. The lessons learned during that month have been translated into discussions intended to help YOU our VMware customers. Their perspectives on what they observed from customers and the common themes of architectural design challenges were eye-opening. Come and hear from those VCDXs some of the most common issues they identified and the ways to mitigate. Take advantage of their time on the front line with GSS to help you design better VMware solutions. During this session, they will also unwrap GSS processes to help you better understand them overall, and to clarify common misconceptions about GSS.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9456-SPO - Implementing Self-Service Storage Provisioning with vRealize Automation XaaS
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vCenter is no longer meant to be the end-user interface for requesting and managing virtual machines and related resources. Storage is no exception. vRealize Automation Anything-as-a-Service (XaaS) provides the ability to easily import vRealize Orchestrator workflows to control, manage and provision storage via the self-service catalog offering in vRealize Automation. This session will include walkthroughs to implement this type of provisioning and examples of some of the various ways XaaS can be leveraged to manage and provision storage.

Presenters.Name: Chris Binger, California Natural Resource Agency
Presenters.LastName: Chris Binger, California Natural Resource Agency

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8615 - vRealize Automation 7 in VMware Cloud Foundation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session covers the integration of VMware vRealize Automation 7.0 with VMware Cloud Foundation. The session walks through the automation of the backend infrastructure for the Software Defined Datacenter stack including vCenter Server, vSphere, VMware NSX, and VMware VSAN. It then covers how to take IT automation functionality and add client self-service capabilities on top, using vRA7 to provide a true Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) solution. Building a true end-to-end automated infrastructure all the way to the end client just got easy. Come learn how.

Presenters.Name: Mark LaRoche, VMware Integrated Systems Business Unit
Presenters.LastName: Mark LaRoche, VMware Integrated Systems Business Unit

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC10623-SPO - The private cloud is dead. Long live the private cloud!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Change is risk and everything, everything, is changing. As organizational IT leaders today, we are faced with not just one, but a set of important IT strategy decisions that will have massive impact on our organization's bottom line, speed of execution, and inevitably its success. These decisions -- moves to the public cloud, adoption of hyperconverged infrastructure, cost tradeoffs in flash storage, use of software defined networking, adoption of containers -- they all represent risk and demand both careful consideration and decisive action. As the CTO of Coho Data, I have spent the past five years working with creative and insightful enterprise IT teams on scalable, software defined data centers. Together, we've built some really exciting systems and solved some very real problems. In this talk, I'll tell you about some of the experiences that we've had in working tightly with large service providers and enterprise private clouds. I'll characterize recent technology trends, and explain some of the near, and intermediate term technology challenges that face traditional datacenter designs. I'll talk about building truly converged, rack-scale IT infrastructure, and the challenges of working with both multi-tenant big data, and containerized workloads. This talk will be a characterization of current technology trends, and a reflection on experiences in working tightly with enterprises to build efficient, scalable, operationally-priced infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8748 - Building a Successful Business Case for VMware Cloud Foundation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The Software-Defined Data Center is the indisputable future of IT. The question for you is how to get your company and IT organization there. You have to choose among different options such as deploy it yourself (DIY) using traditional virtualization, converged or hyperconverged infrastructure, considering factors such as efficiency, flexibility, time to value, ongoing maintenance, ease of use and budget, among others. This session explores the benefits delivered through VMware Cloud Foundation and the financial implications of choosing Cloud Foundation vs. traditional virtualization and HCI appliances. You'll also learn the options and process to purchase and how to build a successful business case for Cloud Foundation.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7692 - Tips for Realizing the Full Value of Your SDDC Transformation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: As with any investment in IT innovation, the goal is to demonstrate measurable business value. In our deep experience assisting customers with their SDDC transformation, we've found that there are two keys to success: 1. Establish and communicate value metrics early, then measure and report on them as your program progresses through its stages to keep everyone, including executives, engaged and committed to the long-term effort. 2. Realize that you cannot expect to manage the SDDC in the same way that you managed your legacy environment. Transforming the organization, people, and processes is essential to achieving the value you set out for. In this presentation, you will learn how to structure and manage your transformation program from the start in order to maximize success and value realization. If you are already on your journey, you will learn how to improve your existing program and fill the gaps that may be holding you back from a successful transformation and realizing value.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9726-SPO - Making SolidFire Invisible in your VMware Environment
PresentationDetailsList.Description: IT organizations have moved from doing more with less to doing even more with less at a faster pace. Adoption of new development frameworks and management technologies continues to rise and creates both challenges and opportunities for businesses. In this talk we'll go over these technologies and how SolidFire integrations work seamlessly behind the seams to change the way IT organizations deliver services, maintain reliability, and prepare for the growth of new technologies for the next generation datacenter. We'll discuss containers, VMware Integrated OpenStack, management with Vvols and Storage Policy Based Management (SPBM), and more. We'll include technical samples, demos, and customer success stories to go beyond simple "marketecture". All of this while reducing the burden on IT organizations.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9612-SPO - How to design and implement VMware’s vCloud in production
PresentationDetailsList.Description: While VMware has created some incredible software to help automate the running of a hybrid cloud infrastructure, they have left many of the important details out of the discussion. Details such as how to put everything together, how to manage the system remotely, how to segment the network and how to build the right firewalls. This talk will be focused on a specific production example architecture designed by Lenovo Professional Services and in use around the world. This example will pull all of the important elements together into a comprehensive architecture and will provide the audience with a live example of how to design and implement VMware vCloud in production.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8154 - Building the Integrated Software Stack
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Building a Software-Defined Data Center requires more than just software. It requires a prescriptive design, testing, tools, and a plan for the future. At this presentation, you will hear from the leaders of VMware Cloud Foundation and the VMware Validated Design teams as they describe how VMware is bringing it all together to help you on your journey to the SDDC.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO9405-SPO - Stopping Global Threats with Converged Infrastructure for the US DoD Cyber Range
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Tegile, CypherPath and ManTech came together to design, engineer, build and operate the Department of Defense Cyber Range to model and simulate the Tier 1 Global Information Grid (GIG) and provide a joint-service environment to enable cyber personnel to train, test, exercise, and evaluate functions they carry out operationally. Come hear how this Converged Virtual Container Platform delivers an IT infrastructure on-demand model by enabling any machines, networks, applications, storage and app containers to be placed inside a software-defined infrastructure container at scale.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9108 - VMware Cloud Foundation – Future Innovations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Cloud Foundation is the easiest way to deploy and operate a software defined data center, thus offering the public cloud experience in the enterprise data center. VMware Cloud Foundation provides both flexibility and powerful new constructs to realize the SDDC. In this session, we will detail some innovations that we are working on for greater agility in the data center using VMware Cloud Foundation. With the workload domain construct, VMware Cloud Foundation provides the ability to run multiple software infrastructure personalities (e.g. VIO, Photon Controller..) on the same physical infrastructure. This talk will describe some of the advanced work in VMware Cloud Foundation and the target use cases.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9181 - VMware Cloud Foundation Backup and Disaster Recovery
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Cloud Foundation based Integrated Systems vastly simplify Day 0 bring-up of the Software Defined Data Center, as well as Day 1+ operations such as backup/restore and disaster recovery. In this session, we discuss the Cloud Foundation architecture and the methods to back up both the management cluster and the tenant workloads. We also discuss common disaster recovery topologies and provide a demonstration of Cloud Foundation disaster recovery, leveraging both NSX and vSAN.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8614 - NSX in VMware Cloud Foundation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session is a deep dive into how to automate and manage your NSX deployment with VMware Cloud Foundation. The session provides a view into how the initial install, ongoing management, and upgrades for NSX are handled within VMware Cloud Foundation. It covers the interlinks that the NSX deployment has with vRealize products, and how Cloud Foundation automates the end-to-end deployment of NSX as part of the VMware Software Defined Datacenter offering. It also introduces the concept of workload domains and how micro-segmentation can be tied with it to provide a powerful secure infrastructure solution to your end clients/customers.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9995-SPO - HPE Hyper Converged – path to composable infrastructure
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Hyperconverged offers customers the ability to simplify their virtualization environments, speed the delivery of new services and lower costs by reducing VM sprawl. Hewlett Packard Enterprise has set a new standard for hyperconverged by offering a very simple and intuitive user experience that enables customers to add capacity in under 15 minutes and quickly deploy VM vending in just 5 clicks. Sound interesting? See how you can: 1) provide a cloud-like experience in the security of your own datacenter, 2) lower costs by 62% (vs the competition) to protect your data, 3) improve the agility of your VMware application virtualization and hybrid cloud environments, and 4) deliver a superior experience for end users through virtual desktop delivery Additionally, learn how the HPE Hyper Converged 380 provides a clear path to next generation Software Defined Data Center called composable infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9465-SPO - Level Up to IT as a Service with Hyper-Converged
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Hyper-converged appliances are powering up from solving point solutions to full-fledged platforms for the modern data center. Remote office, end user computing and departmental workloads were just level one. The rapid pace of advancement in hyper-converged capabilities are unlocking achievements to address a greater number of enterprise use cases. Automation and orchestration expansion packs have hyper-converged poised to beat the next level challenges of IT as a service and agile application deployment. Learn how VCE's hyper-converged VxRail Appliance and VxRack Solutions own both the traditional hyper-converged uses cases as well as these emerging ones.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8357 - If They Come - Are You Ready?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: "Build it and they will come" is an approach many IT organizations take when they set about creating new cloud-based innovation platforms for modernized applications. The surprise for many of them is that they do come, and the challenge shifts to dealing with the success and ongoing management of their new environments. This session provides practical guidance for the operationalization of VMware vRealize Operations and Automation capabilities, using core elements of the Capacity, Demand and Service provisioning processes. The combination of VMware technologies and pragmatic good practice processes will ensure the success of your new service provider model and technology capabilities on "day two" and beyond.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9428-SPO - Practical Strategies for SDI and Security
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Successful enterprises need new customer experiences and methods of engagement to grow their business. These innovative experiences are increasingly built on a foundation of software defined technology. VMware, Intel and their partners have combined to deliver mature SDDC solutions that enable control and transparency with hardware-assisted security for regulated applications, next generation application development and accelerated the migration of mission critical workloads to private cloud and hybrid cloud models. They also reduce both CAPx and OPX costs increasing operational reliability and reduction of cyber risk. This session delivers best practices for enabling developer innovation and operational efficiency. It showcases how hardware-based security and SDDC environments provide data and application boundary control and protection, as well as compliance against the security controls and requirements. It reviews multiple practical strategies to modernize the existing application environment while providing the critical elements to build next generation applications that developers and customers actually want to use.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8445 - VMware Validated Design for Microsegmentation Deepdive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: he traditional model for data center security focuses on primarily on strong perimeter defense but it not enough. Modern attacks exploit this perimeter-only defense, hitching a ride with authorized users, then move laterally within the data center perimeter from workload to workload with little or no controls to block their propagation. Many of the recent public breaches have exemplified this – starting with spear phishing or social engineering, leading to malware, vulnerability exploits, command and control, and unfettered lateral movement with in the data center until the attackers find what they are looking for – which is then ex-filtrated or even held for ransom. Attempting to combat this these issues with hardware-based segmentation hasn’t been operationally feasible in traditional hardware-defined data center networks. Using the traditional firewall approach to quickly reaches two key operational barriers – throughput capacity and operations/change management. These barriers have been the demise of most security team best-laid plans to realize a comprehensive microsegmentation or “Zero-trust” strategy.Until now.The data center has seen a software-defined evolution with segmentation that is operationally feasible -- Microsegmentation.In this session we will discuss how the VMware Validated Designs for Microsegmentation leverages the VMware NSX platform to offer several significant advantages over traditional network security approaches – automated provisioning, automated move/add/change for workloads, distributed enforcement at every virtual interface and in-kernel, scale-out firewalling performance, distributed to every hypervisor – even across data center regions.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8946 - Deep Dive into Deploying the vRealize Cloud Management Platform the VMware Validated Designs Way!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Come learn how to architect and deploy the vRealize Cloud Management Platform (CMP) the VMware Validated Design (VVD) way! VMware Validated Designs are architectures and designs created and validated by VMware experts to encompass the entire set of VMware's Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) products. In this session, architects from the VMware Validated Designs team present a deep drive technical session on how we design and deploy the vRealize CMP -- vRealize Automation, vRealize Orchestrator, vRealize Business for Cloud -- to support 10,000 VMs. This design leverages VMware NSX to enable enterprise capabilities, including high availability and disaster recovery of the cloud management platform itself. Learn more about the architecture and deployment along with the various key design decisions that we made to incorporate VMware best practices. Join us for an informative technical session to learn how we deploy vRealize Automation the VVD way!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8628 - Automating Virtual Desktop Deployments with VMware Cloud Foundation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Building a virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) requires Horizon software integrated with the backend virtual infrastucture with computer, network, and storage. A focus for VMware VMware Cloud Foundation is the automation of the deployment and maintenance of the backend for VDI. This session covers the built-in automation of the deployment of vSphere, VMware NSX, VMware VSAN, vRealize and Horizon components that Cloud Foundation offers. It also describes the integration of App Volumes in this infrastructure, and the ability to dynamically grow this infrastructure with the growth of your desktops, resulting in turnkey VDI deployment. All you need to bring are the desktop images themselves.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8150 - Rack Scale Architecture (RSA) and Software Defined Data Center (SDDC) Innovations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Data centers are facing significant challenges trying to meet growing demands of consumers and enterprises. There is a 2X increase in data volume every 18 months and yet average data center utilizations are only at 50%. What explains this anomaly? Data centers are planned around peak usages but the actual usage is only a fraction of this. In addition, data centers are based on old inflexible architectures - which takes weeks or even months to provision and decommission. Enterprises and Cloud Service Providers are looking for ways to increase the agility and utilization of their fixed data center assets and drive down cost. Enter - Software Defined Data Center (SDDC) & Intel ® Rack Scale Architecture (RSA). Intel Rack Scale Architecture provides the ability to logically disaggregate compute, storage and network resources and pool these resources for better resource utilization based on workload specific demands. Software Defined Data Center as realized through products like VMware Cloud Foundation enable IT to offer the private cloud experience for the enterprise. In this session we will cover innovations in the context of SDDC realized over Rack Scale Architecture. We will detail how a VMware offering like VMware Cloud Foundation and hardware management services (HMS) function can help with such a realization. Both technical and operational aspects of the SDDC along with hardware management will be covered during this session along with related work in industry initiatives like Redfish and Chinook .

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7587r - Software-Defined Networking in VMware Validated Designs
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Validated Designs provide customers and partners with prescriptive guidance for creating and managing their Software Designed Data Center. In VMware Validated Designs, we've used VMware NSX to create new constructs for management applications and utilize the latest features such as universal objects.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9613-SPO - Building the Future Data Center with Province of Nova Scotia
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The Province of Nova Scotia plans its IT infrastructure with an eye toward the distant future to ensure that decisions made today don’t have a negative impact on their infrastructure of tomorrow. As a long time adopter of VMware technology, the Province has elected to standardize on open hardware platforms that can guarantee long term stability. This hardware platform stability gives them the ability to plan for updates and enhancements to their software defined infrastructure. In this session, the Province of Nova Scotia will discuss how and why they standardized on Lenovo Flex System to provide them the stability and open architecture they need to enable a robust software defined infrastructure. They will talk about their transition to Lenovo Flex system and subsequent transition to Lenovo xClarity for simplified hardware device management with plug-in to VMware log insight for seamless interoperability.

Presenters.Name: John Deveau, Province of Nova Scotia
Presenters.LastName: John Deveau, Province of Nova Scotia

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9921-SPO - Evaluating Tradeoffs in Reducing and Eliminating Downtime Inside and Outside of the Software Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: We’ve been promised the end of downtime for decades. But the elimination of downtime, like the horizon, seems to recede as we progress toward it. One reason is that as our IT environments grow increasingly complex, the point products and tools we use to combat downtime have failed to keep pace. What needed is two-fold: 1) A practical evaluation model that enables IT professionals to understand tradeoffs between downtime and the prevention cost of downtime. 2) A continuity framework that enables IT professionals to prevent both homogeneous and heterogeneous downtime – downtime both inside and outside of the SDDC (Software Defined Data Center.) An evaluation model will be reviewed that enables IT professionals to more readily measure and consider various aspects of downtime and costs. Using that model, we’ll do a deep dive into several potential continuity frameworks. These will include 1) A review of continuity frameworks in general. 2) A comparison of continuity frameworks to point products and tools. 3) Continuity frameworks that operate wholly inside of SDDC. 4) Continuity frameworks that operate both inside and outside of SDDC. 5) Continuity frameworks that enable protecting connected SDDC with tightly coupled clouds as well as with third-party hyperscale clouds. 6) Continuity frameworks that allow perimeter level security techniques to extend to data security against malicious attacks (e.g., Ransomware Trojans.) 7) Continuity frameworks that seamlessly enable modern VMware SDDCs to be protected with legacy bare metal clouds and physical hardware, operating systems, and applications

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8520 - No IT Left Behind: Connecting the Software-Defined Data Center to Multi-Modal IT
PresentationDetailsList.Description: As a developer of custom solutions for various public sector agencies, ISS has to be agile to remain competitive. We assessed adopting the much discussed Bi-Modal strategy of splitting into two very distinct groups: Type 1 - traditional IT focused on stability and efficiency and Type 2 - DevOps focused requiring new tools and processes. Instead, we chose to apply a DevOps model spanning our entire IT enterprise in an approach we call Multi-Modal IT. The ISS Multi-Modal IT resulted in a dynamic on-prem environment that supports flexible, timely and relevant capabilities while adhering to a wide range of compliance challenges. Virtualization alone was not sufficient to achieve the types of efficiencies, responsiveness and scale that was required. We needed to extend management to the process level. In this session, you will learn how a combination of vRealize, vSphere, Docker, Ansible, NSX and other technologies have enabled us to modernize enterprise IT without leaving anything behind!

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8423 - VMware Validated Design for SDDC – Operations Architecture Technical Deepdive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Comprehensive and system-level operations is a key aspect of a Software Defined Data Center. Once an SDDC has been deployed, its ongoing performance, health and continuity must be continually and proactively managed. For example, administrators must be notified any time problems develop, or capacity constraints are reached. In this session, you'll learn how the VMware Validated Design for SDDC architecture achieves streamlined data center operations at scale and across regions with distributed deployments of vRealize Operations and vRealize Log Insight together with data protection and day-two guidance for control over performance, capacity, configuration and availability. You'll learn how the key operations integrations are delivered with the use of management and content packs to create comprehensive dashboards, alerts and notifications for the entire Software-Defined Data Center.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8214 - Case Study: VMware's Private Cloud Journey to Over 100K Virtual Machines
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Do you ever wonder how to start or scale your own Private Cloud initiative? Join us and learn about VMware's journey as we continue to navigate all of the technical, people, and process hurdles, and how we financially manage and fund the initiative. VMware's Cloud journey started as a concept and grassroots effort that has evolved into one of the world's largest Private Clouds. Learn about the evolution required to organize the team to take on this challenge, how to navigate key inflection points through scale and maturity, and how to leverage that momentum. The session speakers are directly responsible for the day-to-day management of building and operating VMware's internal Private Cloud. This session's commentary is based on recent, real-world experiences in dealing with the practicalities of responding to today's IT challenges.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8975 - SunTrust's Cloud Journey
PresentationDetailsList.Description: How can a Southern Bank compete with Wall Street? They need to be fast, agile, and drive a culture of innovation and change. SunTrust has built an environment that will create immense value to its customers by delivering on a vision of a stable and efficient cloud that enables its development team to build world-class applications. Listen to Bryan Clements, Senior Vice President of Sun Trust, discuss how he has created an internal focus on innovation and testing new ideas to help their customers. Bryan will discuss how he has addressed not only the technology in creating this cloud platform but also company process and culture. These process and culture changes have enabled the technology to be operated in a more stable and efficient manner, driving down costs and overhead. Those resources can then focus on innovating. Bryan will discuss: 1) His vision of the multi-year transformation journey that he is enabling and how the new wave of applications are creating opportunities for his business. 2) The operational efficiencies needed to build their forward compatible cloud, and the value of the developer-focused model. 3) How a devops model is influencing the culture changes needed to drive this type of platform.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9025 - VVD 101: Build Your Cloud the Right Way, First Time
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Struggling to ensure that your private cloud is designed to meet your business needs? Does the fear of operationalizing your new environment keep you up at night? VMware Validated Designs can help you rapidly deploy a highly tested, scalable, and robust architecture for your private cloud. VMware's experts have been cooking up some highly prescriptive guidance behind the scenes to make sure your deployment is a breeze. Not only will your deployment be simplified, but they will also show you the best practices for supporting your environment with operational guidance on upgrades and patching, backup and and recovery, and even how to run disaster recovery scenarios.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9605-SPO - Using Hyper-intelligence to build next generation storage platforms
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtual datacenters are comprised of a disparate stack of components. Every system, host, switch, and storage system log and present data as each vendor deems fit. Different granularity of information, different time frames, and different output formats make it extremely difficult to correlate data and understand the dynamics of the virtual datacenter. Furthermore, new workloads introduce unique storage requirements, which inevitably require new technology. This not only impacts the design of your data center, it impacts the lifecycle of your IT investments. It's time to remove the boundaries of the different layers in the architecture and integrate different layers of caching, analytics, and storage array technology to drive higher consolidation ratios, reduce complexity, and increase the scale of your virtual datacenter. In this session, Andy Daniel, PernixData Principal Architect, and Bala Narasimhan, PernixData VP, Products will demonstrate how hyper-intelligence allows you to design, deploy, and operate and your next-generation storage platform.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8930 - American Tire Distributors: Our Journey to a Modern Private Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Join ATD's VP of IT Operations, Ravi Ramaraj, as he shares his experiences and practical advice across:

Value found in starting with an actionable assessment
Establishing a strategy and plan for SDDC transformation
Modernizing their data center
Adopting a service oriented IT model with defined services, automation and security"

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9176 - How VMware Cloud Foundation powers the IBM Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Fueled by trends such as business analytics and mobility, the public cloud continues to expand year after year. CIO and VI Architects struggle to provide comparable agility in the private cloud due to the technology and process required to procure, install, manage, patch, and support the core SDDC (vSphere, vSAN, NSX). VMware's Cloud Foundation enables IT to efficiently build, patch, and manage a VMware SDDC on the private and public cloud; enabling a secure, elastic hybrid cloud. This session demonstrates Vmware Cloud Foundation running on the IBM Cloud, its architecture, and how customers are taking advantage of the solution today to deploy and manage their mission critical infrastructure."

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8994 - Taming the Hydra: IT in a Multi-Cloud World
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The benefits of working in a multi-cloud environment are many, but to date the challenges posed to IT have been too great to realize those benefits. VMware is attacking the challenges presented by operating in a multi-cloud environment head-on. As with most advances to solving an IT challenge though, technology is only half the story. To take full advantage of the technical solutions VMware is providing, you also need to look at the impact to your IT operating model. This session explores the IT operational impacts of supporting a multi-cloud environment, and what practical steps IT can take to be successful. It will cover technical operational considerations such as recommended architectural approaches and tool integrations, as well as other operational recommendations including organizational structures, new roles such as cloud specialists, and process changes. Customer examples will be cited to illustrate the best practices we've developed to date.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9448-SPO - Don’t Let Data Protection Drag Down Your Business Transformation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Successful data protection is a cornerstone of any modern data center. Whether you’re leveraging hybrid cloud, hyper-converged infrastructure, or virtualized infrastructure, learn how only EMC Data Protection Everywhere solutions protect your data no matter where it resides, and across the full spectrum of service levels required by your business.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET9460-SPO - Use Cases for Software Defined Data Center with NSX: Transform to Digital Business by deploying multi-tenant agile network in SDDC environment
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many organizations are looking to operate a multi-tenant datacenter serving stakeholders across a growing number of departments managing separate lines of businesses. These organizations need a new data center infrastructure that would enable the ability for departments to self-provision services securely without putting additional demands on internal IT resources. The chosen virtualization strategy included VMware NSX and Brocade Networks as the new data center infrastructure had to be cost-effective and secure without being time-consuming in terms of manual deployment and provisioning. Session Outline: -Multi-tenant uses cases in SDDC environments -How micro-segmentation helps IT enable -departments to self-provision services securely -Architectural solution options -Deployment considerations for H/W VTEP Key Takeaways: • Power of VMware products and technologies such as NSX and vRealize Suite, and its ecosystem integration available to build SDDC architecture for Cloud Service Providers • Deploy multi-tenant network for business agility • How Micro-segmentation help organizations meet compliance requirements • Utilize H/W VTEP for scalability and performance

Presenters.Name: William Bell II, Phoenix Nap LLC
Presenters.LastName: William Bell II, Phoenix Nap LLC

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7819-SPO - Lessons learned to provide secure service assurance for your VMware investments
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Every organization needs to maintain vigilant security practices in the protection of their data and the data of their customers. IT Service Assurance tools are one of the most vulnerable points on the network; simply because they have access to almost everything on the network. Moving to cloud increases that vulnerability. Understand the potential risks to the business and the proactive steps you can take to secure your VMware investments and prevent these evolving network and system threats? Take advantage of the lessons learned by ScienceLogic while undergoing rigorous testing for interoperability and information assurance in order to be deployed by the U.S. Department of Defense.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9023 - Hyperconverged Infrastructure at Scale with VxRack 1000 SDDC
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VxRack SDDC is a turnkey hyper-converged solution that is based on VMware Cloud Foundation software, which provides a complete cloud stack along with lifecycle management. Learn how you can use VxRack SDDC to focus on business innovation rather than struggling to build and maintain a cloud infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8351 - How VMware Cloud Foundation Makes Your Private Cloud Operation More Efficient
PresentationDetailsList.Description: To derive business value from a software defined datacenter it is necessary to have a solid, reliable, and easy to manage technical foundation. But that alone is not sufficient. You also have to ensure that you can operate such an environment effectively. This involves adjusting processes and bringing your people on board. Often the projects to implement a SDDC are dominated by technical aspects. Operational readiness is like an elephant in the room that nobody talks about. Often, you simply do not have the resources to take care of the latter. In this session we will explore how VMware Cloud Foundationsimplifies the technical aspects in such a dramatic way that you can free up project resources to plan for the operational aspects more thoroughly. We will also introduce the operational aspects tailored towards VMware Cloud Foundation. This way you will be able to achieve business benefits much faster and it will sustain better.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC9404-SPO - Reinventing Disaster Recovery Leveraging Public Cloud Infrastructure
PresentationDetailsList.Description: These days, EVERY workload is considered critical by someone in the organization. As a result, SLAs are shrinking. IT is challenged to meet these SLAs, but there isn’t enough budget to provide services like disaster recovery (DR) using traditional methods and infrastructure. The good news is that the public cloud is becoming a viable infrastructure choice for DR with workload portability solutions that make cross-platform or cloud recovery possible. Platforms like VMware vCloud Air, AWS, and Azure provide the ability to bring DR to tier 2 and tier 3 workloads that have never been able to afford it before. In this session, we’ll first look at methods to leverage VM backup to cloud services like vCloud Air Object Storage, AWS S3, or Azure Blob storage for cost-effective disaster recovery. Then, we’ll examine ways to reduce costs by eliminating the significant expense of always-on cloud VMs (needed for replication and retention on many platforms) by leveraging these object storage services as on-demand DR repositories, and only spinning up compute resources when recovery is needed. Next, we’ll explore methods to protect workloads running *in* the cloud until failback to on-prem infrastructure can occur. Finally, we’ll look at how similar processes can be used to streamline Dev/Test operations in the cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7616 - Strategizing Cloud Business Management Using vRealize Business
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The cloud model can facilitate the shift to a business focus for the entire IT hierarchy—from the top to the technical teams managing and delivering the cloud. But to achieve the full business value of the cloud, companies need to put in place a more specialized and robust Cloud Business Management (CBM) practice. The CBM practice addresses the key business aspects of cloud operations. Whether your cloud is greenfield or an evolution of an existing environment, these business considerations are vital to achieving the expected agility and efficiency gains from the cloud model. Cloud business maturity models are used to baseline today's current state and envision tomorrow's desired state. Comprehensive cloud services definition and costing should be performed to solidify the service offerings and help understand its true unit costs. In addition, pricing strategies need to be established based on your organizations goals and cloud vision. This can be streamlined using VMware vRealize Business to drive a service consumption-based business model. Moreover, defining the marketing aspects of your cloud is just as important as the marketing function of any other business. Fully understanding the cloud services demand and consumer use cases will help prioritize the IT investments.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7587 - Software-Defined Networking in VMware Validated Designs
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Validated Designs provide customers and partners with prescriptive guidance for creating and managing their Software Designed Data Center. In VMware Validated Designs, we've used VMware NSX to create new constructs for management applications and utilize the latest features such as universal objects.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8475-QT - A Manager's Guide to the Software-Defined Data Center
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Intimidated by knowing you need to change the way you provide infrastructure and services to your business but not sure how to get started? Just as your data center is unique, so too will be your approach to implementing a Software-Defined Data Center. We will look at your options and help you decide which approach is right for you and your business. We'll explore everything from building your own private cloud with VMware Validated Designs to leveraging the latest in turnkey solutions with VMware Cloud Platform. Come explore your options with us so you can make the best decision for you and your business.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7609-QT - How to Respond to the "Bring Your Own Data Center" Trend
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Research has shown that business units don't always wait any more until their IT department is finally able to deliver infrastructure as a service; instead they buy it directly themselves. Business units can use their own virtual data center from the cloud: Bring Your Own Data Center (BYODC). They are increasingly turning to Amazon Web Services, Azure, vCloud Air, and other public cloud platforms to run their workloads. Most of the time this starts with development and test workloads, but increasingly occurs for production workloads as well. This causes challenges for the IT department regarding security, management, compliance, and costs. We will address the four common responses from IT departments to BYODC and how successful these responses are.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7881-QT - Cloud Service Lifecycle in a DevOps-Focused Delivery Model
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The new Cloud Operations Group is about delivering agility, efficiency, and business value. There is constant pressure on companies to introduce products and services rapidly into new and existing marketplaces. These pressures and demands all require the IT organization to become more service-oriented. They also make it more important than ever for IT to improve its strategy to deliver services with the agility that businesses now expect. This session aims to provide an introduction as to how the cloud service development and delivery model can be streamlined, with an emphasis on agile devops practices.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC8945-QT - Learning in the Cloud: VMware Education's New Enterprise Learning Subscription
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Education's new Enterprise Learning Subscription is a newly introduced offering. It offers 19 courses that map to all of VMware's SDDC solutions, access to our cloud-based video training library taught by top VMware experts, and certification exam vouchers and exam prep packages to help you prepare to pass the exam. As it is becoming more difficult for support technicians, administrators, and users of VMware technology to take time away from their job responsibilities to attend a five-day class, the ELS offers the perfect solution. This session reviews the ELS and explains the business benefits that customers are receiving.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: SDDC7876-QT - Service Automation Roadmap: Approach and Samples
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Are you embarking on a private cloud implementation? Planning is key, and thus you need a roadmap. Service automation is essential for getting the most out of your private cloud, so you need to plan that too.

You have probably already selected and installed the key technologies, such as infrastructure platform, cloud management, and operations management. However, service automation and provisioning are not just about the tools. You also need to address people and processes to ensure that you operate efficiently and that your team is ready to support this new way of doing business.

This session will provide practical guidance on designing a roadmap for service automation, in terms of tools, people, and process, and explore example roadmaps developed for customers who have successfully implemented a private cloud and service automation.
